file_content.text: [This comm station has been deactivated.]
Our techs are hacked in and ready. Now let's see where the Imperial Guard's been hiding.
Imperial Guard orders are being transmitted from the Museum Republica. Looks like they want to hit us where it hurts.
That rules out aerial bombardment or a major assault. One stray grenade could destroy centuries of history.
Does the Imperial Guard have any weaknesses?
We need strategy here.
They're isolated from the rest of the Empire. They only answer to their commanding officer.
Is there any way to get the Imperial Guard into the open?
Can we lure them out?
No chance. They've got a good position, and they know it.
Artifacts and exhibits aren't worth losing this battle.
History shouldn't stop us.
The Museum Republica represents everything we're trying to protect. We have to preserve what we can.
These dispatch orders come from Commander Tainor, head of the Imperial Guard.
The commander's the one with the battle plan. If something happened to him, it would take time for the Imperial Guard to adjust.
Have you faced Commander Tainor before?
Any more intel on this man?
He's ruthless. Officers have surrendered rather than face him.
Would it be enough to catch them off guard?
How much time, exactly?
An hour, maybe less. But that's all the time I'd need to take out their men in Axial Park.
Are you asking me to kill him?
"Something" meaning what?
Commander Tainor doesn't negotiate, and he'd never surrender. I don't see any other options.
If the commander's smart, he'll post a few men at the door and hide the rest in the museum. Move fast and stay sharp.
The Museum Republica's collection dates back to the founding. Spare anything you can from the cross fire.
Anything broken, the Empire will pay for.
I'll save what I can.
Let's hope the Empire hasn't taken anything of value.
If it's still there.
The whole museum's valuable. But they won't have it for long.
The Imperial Guard might not be so considerate.
I'll try, but they won't.
If damage has to be done, I'd rather it be the Empire's fault.
This stuff wouldn't be worth any creds, would it?
Finders keepers?
I'll pretend I didn't hear that.
Can the Republic handle another Imperial attack?
Will you be alright?
We can hold Axial Park, as long as there's no more surprises.
I'm here to fight, not collect trinkets.
No promises here.
Those trinkets are Republic history. You might not value them, but others do.
Get inside the museum and find the commander. I'll send reinforcements as soon as I can.
The spike's in, General. You should have access to the Empire's systems.
[Access denied.]
